bill_title: change the purpose of the veterans affairs special revenue fund.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to redirect moneys in the veterans affairs special revenue fund. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 33-17-3 be repealed. 33-17-3. There is hereby continued in the state treasury a "veterans affairs division special revenue fund." Said fund shall be used for the purposes set forth in §§ 33-17-7 and 33-17-9. Section 2. That § 33-17-4 be repealed. 33-17-4. Any amounts paid or contributed by the United States government or any agency thereof, by reason of or to compensate for the expenditures referred to in § 33-17-7, shall be paid into and be a part of the veterans affairs division special revenue fund. Section 3. That § 33-17-5 be repealed. 33-17-5. Any repayment of loans and interest thereon, shall be receipted into the veterans affairs division special revenue fund and all moneys in said fund are hereby appropriated for the purposes provided for in §§ 33-17-7 and 33-17-9. Section 4. That § 33-17-6 be repealed. 33-17-6. Disbursements from the veterans affairs division special revenue fund shall be made by warrants drawn by the state auditor upon vouchers approved by the director of the Division of Veterans Affairs. Section 5. That § 33-17-7 be repealed. 33-17-7. The Legislature finds that the care of the dependents of those in active service or of those who have died while in active service, and the postwar adjustment of all military personnel of the United States, are primarily and justly the obligations of the federal government. However, because of the possibility of delay in making arrangements to extend such care or to complete that readjustment, the veterans affairs division special revenue fund may be used for the purpose of extending emergency aid and assistance: (1) To the dependents of those who are in active service or who have died in active service, during the time when allotments, gratuity pay, arrears pay, insurance claims, widow or widower pensions, or any other claim or benefit of such dependents are being adjudicated or processed, or if financial relief is required for any emergency need; (2) To any veteran or veteran's dependents while any application for schooling or business rehabilitation, compensation, hospitalization, or any other benefit is being adjudicated or processed, or if financial relief is required for any emergency need. Section 6. That § 33-17-8 be repealed. 33-17-8. Funds shall be advanced to any veteran or to the veteran's dependents under § 33- 17-7 if emergency need has been established to the satisfaction of the director of the Division of Veterans Affairs, under rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 by the Veterans Commission, and upon agreement by the veteran or the veteran's dependents that the funds so loaned shall be repaid without interest and are due two years from the date the money is loaned. The agreement shall be in a form prescribed by the Department of Military and Veterans Affairs, and money repaid shall be paid into the veterans affairs division special revenue fund under the control of the department. In no case may the sums loaned to any veteran, or to the aggregate of the veteran's dependents, exceed the sum of five hundred dollars. Section 7. That § 33-17-9 be repealed. 33-17-9. Moneys in the fund described in § 33-17-3 may be expended to pay the compensation and expenses of employees of the Division of Veterans Affairs engaged in the examination or investigation of on-the-job training projects, opportunities and conditions and in providing for and assisting veterans to obtain on-the-job training. Section 8. That § 33-17-10 be repealed. 33-17-10. For the purposes of §§ 33-17-3 and 33-17-9, a veteran is a person who has served in the armed forces of the United States, who is in wartime service, or who is a veteran as defined in § 33-17-1, who was a legal resident of South Dakota at the time of entry into service or who, following discharge, has been a resident of this state for one year. However, a nonresident in this state is entitled to any benefits which are available in the nonresident's state to a South Dakota resident under the same conditions. Section 9. That § 33-17-11 be repealed. 33-17-11. The provisions of §§ 33-17-7 to 33-17-10, inclusive, shall be construed liberally in order to effectuate their purposes. Section 10. Any funds in the Veterans Affairs Division special revenue fund created by § 33- 17-3 as of June 30, 2009, shall revert to the state general fund.
